title: ameliabrw
author: ameliabrw
content: I would like to share my experience in brief1-Your platform was not very fluid, sometimes it did not detect the sell or buy order.2-Your interface was slow, and it was difficult for me to make my trades.3-They say they have the best raw spread which is also false.4-I found that their platform is made with this site https://dx.trade/ which they also denied.And after trying to pass phase 1 I was fed up and preferred to switch to another propfirm like Cryptofundtrader, TFT and Maven.And with these three I am doing very well especially with Cryptofundtrader since I trade more frequently with cryptos.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Thanks for the warnings; it might not be helpful for me, but my university mate is into crypto, and he was talking about prop firm today with me, I actually came to meet him often as he is in another section and I am in another, and we both were free so we exchanged information, He said he is spending time in a prop firm, and I was totally unaware of the term so I asked more and he shared all the details, like how he passed the test, etc.Overall, thanks for the review. I don't know if your review is really legit or just a marketing technique, but I will look into it later. But hey, you did not provide the link to that proposition. I think you tried to write it named in brackets (bright funded), right?Can you share your experience with the ones you are using now?

comments.author: Ben Barubal
comments.body: Thank you very much for what you said, but I hope you gave an example of what you are talking about so that I or anyone else who is curious about what you are saying can somehow have an idea.   But anyway, how long have you tried to use it? When it's like that, because I'm not used lightly because I'm not familiar with something, I know first before I enter it or use it so that the money I put in will not be wasted anyway.

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: Those are the unpopular exchanges, I’m wondering why choose it if you already have the best option in the market? Are you not allowed to use top exchanges? This is actually what I don’t want to experience especially with my trades and that’s why I always choose the best option and choosing the best option means having a peace of mind as well. If you want to trade smoothly, always go for the best.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Thank you for sharing your experience. It is difficult to believe that you will continue to use this service. Not discovering buy and sell orders, paid UI buys, and slow trading are all indicators of technical or software problems, both of which are due to limited funding, so at any time they may either stop or turn into fraud, or There is an insider attack or any other form that will lead to the loss of your money.

comments.author: slaman29
comments.body: Thanks for the warning but I think the real warning is for the platform you recommended.New account only with this 1 single "review" post, assasinating one company to promote another one lolLike Johnyz says, there are way better ones. Why are we looking at new ones with no reputation? You risk your funds just depositing there.

comments.author: Traderbtcc
comments.body: Quote from: ameliabrw on October 19, 2023, 04:04:34 PMI would like to share my experience in brief1-Your platform was not very fluid, sometimes it did not detect the sell or buy order.2-Your interface was slow, and it was difficult for me to make my trades.3-They say they have the best raw spread which is also false.4-I found that their platform is made with this site https://dx.trade/ which they also denied.And after trying to pass phase 1 I was fed up and preferred to switch to another propfirm like Cryptofundtrader, TFT and Maven.And with these three I am doing very well especially with Cryptofundtrader since I trade more frequently with cryptos.I appreciate you sharing your experience! With the rise of prop firms in crypto, we've seen similar situations, but that doesn't mean there aren't reputable ones out there. Personally, if I were to trade with prop firms, I'd stick to the well-known ones with a proven track record. Unlike the up-and-coming firms that make big promises but often fall short in delivering. Trust is key.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: slaman29 on October 20, 2023, 11:46:51 AMNew account only with this 1 single "review" post, assasinating one company to promote another one lolSo obvious and still so few catch this from the first read, common, what user would not take the time to actually check what they say about the one where they go scammed but instead spend more time to mention twice the alternative?I would not touch it with a two-mile pole!Btw, to everyone replying, you're wasting your time unless you post for your quota, the user is not interested in discussing a thing:https://ninjastic.space/post/62623082https://ninjastic.space/post/62609453
